name: humpy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a hump or humps (= large, round raised areas or parts): The narrow track wound its way through a humpy desert landscape. The humpy piles of rock and soil look like big moguls on a smooth ski slope.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the edge of the city there was a humpy line of green mounds, perhaps with old treasures buried inside.The shrub should be pruned in stages to create a rounded, humpy hedge.

a type of temporary shelter, often built on the edge of a town: In the 1800s, the city was still a small settlement of muddy streets and wooden humpies. Their camp consisted of two neat humpies, a small horse, and a milk cow.
More examplesFewer examplesBy 1895, the number of tents, humpies, and huts on the edge of town had risen to 200.Crossing the floor of the humpy, I looked out of the doorway and saw the porch where the young people were sitting.His wife did the cooking, and kept the humpies tidy and clean.
